intro: Condylostylis phlebophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leafed swampmallow, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and showy, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland or swampy habitats, thriving in moist, acidic soils. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small aquatic organisms. Condylostylis phlebophylla is often found in areas with standing water, such as billabongs and marshes.
